value: WV Belarussian phrasebook banner 10000 rubles note.jpg

.

Belarusian and Russian are the two official languages, but
is more widely spoken. It would be difficult to get by in Belarus without some knowledge of Russian. However, the two languages are closely related (as is
), so even the Belarusian monolinguals understand some Russian and Ukrainian.
is also spoken in the western parts of Belarus, especially around
. Also, all traffic signs and street signs are written in Belarusian.

value: The Belarusian-speaking world. The dark blue indicates areas where Belarusian is the majority language; light blue areas contain a significant Belarusian-speaking minority.

Belarusian boasts its own adaptation of the Cyrillic alphabet, standing out from the rest of the Slavic alphabets. Below you'll find an example of the Belarusian Cyrillic alphabet. (The palatal sounds are made with one's tongue touching the roof of his mouth.)

 
;Аа Бб Вв Гг Ґґ Дд ДЖдж ДЗЬдзь Ее Ёё Жж Зз Іі Йй Кк Лл Мм Нн Оо Пп Рр Сс СЬсь Тт Уу Ўў Фф Хх Цц Чч Шш Ыы Ьь Ээ Юю Яя :

;Аа : like the 'a' in 'alone'
;Яя : like "ya" in "yard" or the "ia" in "mia"
;Ее : like "ye" in "yet" or the "ie" in "miedo"
;Ёё : like "yo" in "yonder" or the "io" in "frio"
;Ээ : like "e" in "met"
;Йй : like "y" in "play" or "boy". It's a semivowel, and it is always combined with a full vowel.
;Іі : like "ee" in "see"
;Ыы : like the 'y' in 'possibly'
;Оо : like "o" in "open"
;Уу : like "oo" in "boot"
;Юю : like "u" in "duke"[iu]

;Бб : like "b" in "bit" 
;Вв : like "v" in "vine" 
;Гг : approx. like "h" in "how" [aspirated like the 'ck' in "brick"]     
;Ґґ : like "g" in "go" [not often used]
;Дд : like "d" in "do" 
;ДЖдж : like "j" in "journey"
;ДЗЬдзь : approx. like "ds" in "raids"
;Жж : like "s" in "pleasure"
;Зз : like "z" in "zoo" 
;ЗЬзь : soft palatalized sound in between "z" and "zh".
;Кк : like "k" in "kitten"
;Лл : like "l" in "lady"
;ЛЬль : soft "l" like "l" in "lemon"
;Мм : like "m" in "my"
;Нн : like "n" in "not" or like the "ny" in "canyon"
;НЬнь : like "n" in "near"
;Пп : like "p" in "pot"
;Рр : trilled "r" (similar to a Spanish "r")
;Сс : like "s" in "sun"
;СЬсь : soft palatalized sound in between "s" and "sh".
;Тт : like "t" in "tip"
;Ўў : like final "w" in "window"
;Фф : like "f" in "face"
;Хх : like "ch" in Scottish "loch"
;Цц : like "ts" in "cats"
;ЦЬць : soft palatalized sound in between "ts" and "ch".
;Чч : like the 'ch' in "chest"
;Шш : like "sh" in "shut"
;Ьь : silent

; ай : like 'eye'
; яй : like saying 'ya' in "yard" and 'eye' [yah-ee]
; ой : like 'oy' in "boy" [oy]
; ей : like 'ye' in "yet" and 'ay' in "play" [yeh ee]
; эй : like 'ey' in "prey" [ey]
; ый : like 'i' in "Chris" and 'y' in "yes" similar to saying "possibly yes" [ee yeh]
; уй : like 'oo' in "good" and 'y' in "yet" [oo yeh]
; юй : like 'you' and 'y' in "play" [yoo ee]
; аў : like 'ou' in "out" [ah oo]
; яў : like saying 'ya' in "yard" and 'ou' in "out" [yah oo]
; оў : like the 'ow' in "grow" [oh oo]
; еў : like 'ye' in "yet" and 'wo' in "won't" [yeh woh]
; эў : like 'e' in 'end' and 'wo' in "won't" [eh woh]

)
; What is your name? : Як вас завуць? (

)
; Nice to meet you. : Прыемна пазнаёміцца. (

)
; I don't speak____. : Я не размаўляю______. (

)
; Do you speak English? : Ці размаўляеце па-ангельску ?  (

)
; I don't understand anything. : Я нічога не разумею. (

)
; Where is the toilet? : Дзе туалет? (''dzyeh tualyet??)

; NOTE: The days from Monday to Sunday are written in Belarusian in lowercase letters and not like the English days, which are capitalized.
 
; Monday : панядзелак (

; NOTE: The months in Belarusian are written in lowercase letters and not like the English months, which are capitalized.
 
; January : студзень (
; How much is a ticket to _____? : Колькі каштуе білет да _____? (

)
; One ticket to _____, please. : Адзін білет да _____,калі ласка. (

)

)
; Where is the train/bus to _____? : Дзе цягніком / аўтобусам да______?  (

)

)
; Where are there a lot of... : Куды там шмат... (

)
; Take me to _____, please. : Вазьмі мяне _____, калі ласка. (

value: KOHL'-kee geh-TAH BOOD-zeh kahsh-TAH-vahts' kahb dah-BRAH-tsah _____?

; Take me there, please. : Вазьмеце мяне, калі ласка. (

)
; Do you have any rooms? : Ці ёсць у вас Нумары?  (

)
; How much is a room for one person/two people? : Колькі каштуе пакой на аднаго чалавека/двух чалавек?  (

value: KOHL'kee KASH-tooie pah-KOY nah ahd-NAH-goh chah-lah-VYEH-kah/dvookh chah-LAH-vyehk?

)
; Does the room come with... : Ці ў пакой прыйшоў з ...  (

)
; May I see the room first? : Ці магу я бачыць у пакоі ў першую чаргу?  (

value: tsih MAH-goo yah BAH-sheets' oo PAH-koy wah pehr-SHOO-iu CHAHR-goo?

)

)
